ygData.subject: RE: Some Questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Welcome! I think you got your GZ answer?  You read the response we got from him on som ebard questions - his sig was at the bottom. The gargoyles are found in
ygData.messageBody:
Welcome!

I think you got your GZ answer? You read the response we got from him on
som ebard questions - his sig was at the bottom.

The gargoyles are found in the Ocean of Tears (take the boat from Freeport
and it sails through OOT). I do not have first hand experience with them
but a monk friend had been to visit them and he is about 20ish. He trained
the giant skels to the Gargs and feigned i guess. Then let the Garg and
Skel duke it out. Then he recoved and killed the weakened Garg. Not sure
you could handle them at level 12 - i got the feeling they were higher level
but really dont know.

Sylly Songsynger
Bard of the 35th Song
<Spirit of the Moon>
somewhere on Innoruuk

-----Original Message-----
From: Peck White [mailto:peck_white@...]
Sent: Wednesday, November 10, 1999 10:47 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Some Questions



Here is my original post. Somehow it didn't make the trip.

Hi,

I've been lurking on the list and decided it's time to join in. Here are a
couple of questions.

Who is GZ? I've seen it mentioned several times in talking about Verant,
but it's not in the glossary I went to to try and get an answer.

I've just gotten my 12th song and have been hunting Dervs in N Ro. ButI
remember reading somewhere about an Island that has Gargoyles that would be
appropriate
for someone near my level to hunt. I remember theposter said that the loot
was worth about a plat each and weighed 0.1lbs. Does this ring any bells
for
anyone?

The Derv camps are just too crowded and often with people that think they
are super-heros. I lost my 12th level and had to regain it from just such a

person. Killed while memming bellow for the first time andthey trained the
Dervs onto me. (Grrr)

Anyway, I've enjoyed the interaction here and look forward to your
responses. Thanks in advance and

May your voice always sing true,

Tomerrilin

Bard of the 12th Song

Mithaniel Marr
